getDefaultAgentPort

int getDefaultAgentPort()
Returns:
The default agent port assigned to all machine instances created through this connector.

createMachineInstance

IMachine createMachineInstance(String name,
                               String internalName,
                               String ipAddress,
                               IComputeCenter computeCenter,
                               IMachineDescriptor machineDescriptor,
                               IImage image,
                               int agentPort)
                               throws InvalidObjectException
Create a machine instance within the controller database representing the instance created through the connector. Use this create machine when the IP address is known at machine create time. This operation should be invoked within the connector implementation before returning from the IConnector.createMachine(IComputeCenter, IImage, IMachineDescriptor) method.

Parameters:
name - The machine name. This name should be unique for all currently managed machines.
internalName - The machine internal name.
ipAddress - The machine IP address. This value should be unique for all currently managed machines.
computeCenter - The compute center where the machine is created.
machineDescriptor - The machine descriptor.
image - The image used to create the machine instance.
agentPort - The machine agent port, most likely the default agent port.
Returns:
The machine instance with the id set.
Throws:
InvalidObjectException - if the machine instance cannot be created.

createMachineInstance

IMachine createMachineInstance(String name,
                               String internalName,
                               IComputeCenter computeCenter,
                               IMachineDescriptor machineDescriptor,
                               IImage image,
                               int agentPort)
                               throws InvalidObjectException
Create a machine instance within the controller database representing the instance created through the connector. Use this create machine as opposed to the one where the IP address is explicitly provided as an input parameter if the IP address is not known at machine create time. If this is the case then most likely the connector will be able to set the machine IP address at some later time when the machine state is refreshed. This operation should be invoked within the connector implementation before returning from the IConnector.createMachine(IComputeCenter, IImage, IMachineDescriptor) method.

Parameters:
name - The machine name. This name should be unique for all currently managed machines.
internalName - The machine internal name.
computeCenter - The compute center where the machine is created.
machineDescriptor - The machine descriptor.
image - The image used to create the machine instance.
agentPort - The machine agent port, most likely the default agent port.
Returns:
The machine instance with the id set.
Throws:
InvalidObjectException - if the machine instance cannot be created.
